ProcessState class

class ProcessState.ProcessState(solution)

Bases: object

Data class that contains information about a process state

Parameters

solution¶ (Solution) – Solution

Variables

  • state_grid – StateGrid that shows where obstacles and completed layouts occupy nodes

  • aimed_solution – Solution that contains information of the desired construction. Is recalculated after a detour event.

  • last_event_trail – Trail at which the last non deviated event occurred.

  • part_stock – Dictionary containing the number of available parts in stock.

  • picked_parts – List containing parts picked from stock. Parts will be removed upon usage.

  • building_instructions – (See BuildingInstructions) Dictionary containing information about the required placements and IDs of parts to complete the construction process. Is recalculated after a detour event.

  • motion_dict – Dictionary containing all registered motion events that are valid (non-error) that point to a ConstructionState. The keys for pipe events are of the type Trail, while other events are of the type Pos.

  • last_event_info – (See BuildingInstructions) Dictionary containing information of the last event that occurred.

adjust_motion_dict_to_solution(solution, detour_event=None)

Reevaluates all entries in the motion dict according to the given solution.

Parameters

  • solution¶ – New solution.

  • detour_event¶ – Element that caused detour event: Dictionary containing a trail and building instruction.

assign_pipe_id(pipe_state, pipe_id)
attachment_placed(event_pos, event_code, building_instruction, event_info)

Evaluates the placement of an attachment. Notes findings into event_info.

Parameters

  • event_info¶ – See EventInfo

  • building_instruction¶ – See BuildingInstruction

check_assignment_pipe_id(current_layout, event_info)
check_detour_event(event_pos, event_code)

Checks if conditions for a detour event are met. Detour event occurs if: 1. 2 fittings in proximity (connectable by available parts) 2. 1 attachment in between those 2 fittings 3. 1 pipe (with correct or unknown id) in between those fittings

Parameters

  • event_pos¶ – See event_pos

  • event_code¶ – See event_code

completed_instruction(building_instruction)

Checks if the building instruction was completed. and returns event code corresponding to its completion state.

evaluate_placement(event_pos, event_code, ignore_part_check=False, ignore_obstructions=False, assume_pipe_id_from_solution=False)

Evaluates a placement event and registers changes to motion_dict according to building_instructions. Also registers if an instruction has been completed.

Parameters

  • event_pos¶ – Position where motion event occurred.

  • event_code¶ – Event code of motion event.

  • ignore_part_check¶ – Option for ignoring part restrictions. See ProcessPlanner.ignore_part_check

  • ignore_obstructions¶ – Option for ignoring obstructions. See ProcessPlanner.ignore_obstructions

  • assume_pipe_id_from_solution¶ – todo: doc

fitting_placed(event_pos, building_instruction, event_info, assume_pipe_id_from_solution, ignore_part_check, current_layout)

Evaluates the placement of a fitting. Notes findings in event_info. If picked_parts is set to None, part restrictions will be ignored

get_all_att_positions()
get_all_fit_positions()
get_all_pipe_positions()
get_construction_state(find_me, event_codes)

returns construction state and pos/trail if pos and event_code specified are in motion_dict.

Parameters

  • find_me¶ (Union[Pos,Trail]) – Position or trail to find in motion_dict.

  • event_codes¶ – List containing event codes valid for search.

Returns

If nothing was found, returns a tuple containing None, otherwise returns a tuple containing the position or trail and its construction state

get_current_layout_and_building_instruction(event_code, event_pos)

Returns the current layout and building instruction if event occurred inside solution.

Parameters

  • event_pos¶ – See event_pos

  • event_code¶ – See event_code

Returns

Tuple containing the current layout and building instruction and a value that signifies if the layout has changed from the previous one.
